programme.desc: Brittany's genetic condition causes head-to-toe bumps. Leonardo has a fist-size growth on his head. Tamyra has skin so thick that she shaves the bottom of her feet for relief. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Pop-up facts and behind-the-scenes secrets are revealed. Jaclyn has a distressing head lump. The growth between Shane's eyes could be dangerous. Brittany has seen multiple doctors about the sores on her body with no answers. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dr. Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Juicy pop-up facts and behind-the-scenes secrets are revealed. Stacey's shoulder growth prevents her from being the playful teacher she once was. Matthew worries the rash on his shin may be dangerous. Mark has a growth in his pubic area. (Repeat).

programme.title: Amanda Seales: I Be Knowin'
programme.desc: In her HBO debut, Amanda Seales humorously explores social norms and personal identity, engaging the audience with her unique perspective. (Repeat).

programme.title: Alex Edelman: Just For Us
programme.desc: In the wake of a string of anti-Semitic threats online, comedian Alex Edelman goes straight to the source, covertly attending a meeting of white nationalists and coming face-to-face with the people behind the keyboards. (Repeat).

programme.title: 7 Days in Hell
programme.desc: A mockumentary chronicling an epic tennis match at Wimbledon between outrageous American troublemaker Aaron Williams and dim-witted English prodigy Charles Poole. (Repeat).

programme.title: Leo Reich: Literally Who Cares?!
programme.desc: Leo Reich faces the swirling uncertainty of our collective future, asking the big questions. Treading the line between hilarious stand-up and humorless performance art, this special blends songs, anecdotes, and anxious non-sequiturs in a valiant attempt to raise awareness about important social and political causes or something. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: Texan Renee Zellweger boasts a perfect English accent in this delightful adaptation of Helen Fielding's novel. She plays Bridget, a London "singleton" desperate to lose weight, cut down on her vices and find Mr. Right. The film chronicles her romantic entanglements with two gents: her playboy boss (Hugh Grant) and a snooty lawyer (Colin Firth). Jim Broadbent, Gemma Jones. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Renée Zellweger, Colin Firth and Hugh Grant return for this must-see sequel. Charming but insecure Bridget has finally landed the reserved Mr. Darcy (Firth), but she is concerned that their relationship won't last. Adding to her worries is the fact that her new employers have paired her with her womanizing ex-boyfriend, Daniel Cleaver (Grant). (Repeat).

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: Bridget Jones, now a fortysomething news producer, discovers that she's pregnant in this hilarious comedy sequel. However, she isn't sure if the baby's father is Mark Darcy, her on-and-off boyfriend, or Jack Qwant, her new American love interest. (Repeat).

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this hysterical big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. (Repeat).

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. (Repeat).

programme.title: Pretty Woman
programme.desc: A Hollywood hooker signs on for a weeklong job with a john who is a corporate raider; he pays for a makeover so she can act as his "date." (Repeat).

programme.title: Pulling Strings
programme.desc: This adorable comedy follows an ambitious mariachi singer who hopes to convince a customs worker to accept his visa, and finds love in the process. (Repeat).

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton are dynamic in this witty romantic comedy. Nicholson plays an aging Lothario with a young girlfriend. He meets his soul mate, however, when he's introduced to his lover's mother, a playwright who can't stand the sight of him. (Repeat).

programme.title: Seth Meyers: Dad Man Walking
programme.desc: ​Emmy-winning writer, New York Times bestselling author, and SNL alum Seth Meyers stars in his first HBO stand-up special. Known for his dry wit and sharp topical commentary as host of Late Night with Seth Meyers, the comedian shifts his focus to his personal life – from the chaos of raising three young kids, to navigating different communication styles in marriage, and more. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Polished and incisive remake of the 1939 classic about a sisterhood of well-to-do New Yorkers who rally around their friend (Meg Ryan) when they learn her husband is having an affair. As in the original, the film features an all-female cast, including Annette Bening, Jada Pinkett Smith, Eva Mendes and Debra Messing. Written and directed by TV veteran Diane English, who based her script on the 1936 play by Clare Boothe Luce. Rolling Stone Mick Jagger is one of the producers. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison in this uproarious comedy. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sam Jay: Salute Me or Shoot Me
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Sam Jay takes the stage at Brooklyn Steel for a hilariously frank discussion on embracing our differences, the stresses of long-term relationships, and the power of empathy. Newly engaged, Jay gets candid about life with her future wife and the unknown stresses of being "the man," the grim reality of trash day, and more. (Repeat).

programme.title: Save Yourselves!
programme.desc: A Brooklyn couple decides to unplug themselves from the internet via a therapeutic retreat to a phone-free cabin in upstate New York. Murderous aliens descend on Earth as they go off the digital grid, leaving them hopelessly uninformed about the apocalypse. (Repeat).

programme.title: Good Hair
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Rock channels his razor-sharp wit in a new direction in this illuminating documentary about the role of hair in the African-American community and its far-reaching effect on cultural identity. Also: a look at the highly competitive world of black stylists. (Repeat).

programme.title: Lil Rel Howery: I Said It. Y'all Thinking It.
programme.desc: For his second HBO stand-up special, Lil Rel Howery returns home to Chicago to share candid takes on fame, fatherhood, and therapy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Writer-director Tyler Perry's fourth film is an uproarious, insightful comedy about a hard-luck single mom (Angela Bassett) from Chicago who attends her long-estranged father's funeral in rural Georgia and meets a clan of offbeat relatives she didn't know she had. Former NBA star Rick Fox costars as a college hoops coach who is romantically interested in Bassett. Perry costars as Joe and has a cameo as his recurring character, the larger-than-life matriarch, Madea. (Repeat).

programme.title: Clear History
programme.desc: A marketing executive at an electric-car start-up quits after an argument with his boss, but is crushed when the company hits the big time, so he tries to reinvent his life under a different name in the peace and quiet of Martha's Vineyard. (Repeat).

programme.title: 7 Days in Hell
programme.desc: A mockumentary chronicling an epic tennis match at Wimbledon between outrageous American troublemaker Aaron Williams and dim-witted English prodigy Charles Poole. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dream Scenario
programme.desc: The narrative follows a very unkempt professor named Paul Matthews. His life is quite uneventful until suddenly, his image appears in people's dreams. Soon, millions of strangers find themselves dreaming about him. The event made him an overnight sensation. However, things change when these dreams soon become nightmares for some and, later, for many. (Repeat).

programme.title: Forever My Girl
programme.desc: A country-music star returns to his hometown, where he reconnects with an old flame—and is shocked to learn that they have a daughter together. In time, he reflects on the life he left behind and the man he wants to be in this stirring romance. (Repeat).

programme.title: America's Sweethearts
programme.desc: In this all-star, screwball comedy, an estranged Hollywood couple (Catherine Zeta-Jones, John Cusack) tries to create the illusion that they're happy at a press junket for their upcoming movie. Julia Roberts also stars as the actress's sister, who secretly loves brother-in-law Cusack. Billy Crystal, Christopher Walken, Hank Azaria, Stanley Tucci. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: A bride-to-be in Greece attempts to solve the mystery of her paternity by reading her mother's diary. Based on the popular ABBA-inspired stage musical. (Repeat).

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Living in the perfect Barbieland, Barbie and Ken lead a carefree existence, but soon, Ken finds himself questioning his simple life. Enamored by the human world, he convinces Barbie to leave their comfort zone and take a trip outside Barbieland. Soon, the Mattel CEO feels threatened by the duo's daring decision and pursues them to guide them back to where they belong. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: The romantic adventures of fashionable New York City writer Carrie Bradshaw (Sarah Jessica Parker) and her three chic friends continue in what could be the ultimate chick flick, a glitzy, gal-pleasing movie adaptation of the popular HBO series. Expect love, marriage plans and maybe even a baby carriage. Kim Cattrall, Cynthia Nixon, Kristen Davis, Chris Noth. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dan Soder: Son of a Gary
programme.desc: Dan Soder delivers sharp comedy in his first HBO special. He tackles topics like airport drug dogs, quirky customer service, and growing up with an alcoholic dad. (Repeat).

programme.title: John Early: Now More Than Ever
programme.desc: In his first HBO comedy special, John Early brings his unique blend of cutting commentary, pop star swagger, and all-around loveable hilarity to Roulette Intermedium in Brooklyn, New York. In the style of a gritty 70s rockumentary, Early performs stand-up and explosive song covers from Britney to Neil Young, intercut with Spinal Tap-esque backstage sketches. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wonder Woman 1984
programme.desc: Diana must thwart the schemes of two new enemies, media mogul Maxwell Lord and her former friend Barbara Ann Minerva as the threat of the Cold War looms over American soil. However, she must also grapple with the unexpected return of her lost love, Steve. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mel Brooks: Unwrapped
programme.desc: A spotlight on comedy legend Mel Brooks' life and career features archival interviews and clips from some of his most memorable works, including "Young Frankenstein" and "The Producers," as well as a spaghetti-and-meatball feast with fellow nonagenarian and longtime friend Carl Reiner. (Repeat).

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: Mexican teenager Jaime Reyes returns home from college full of idealism and hope for his country's future. But his home isn't as he left it. Dejected and without direction now that his dreams have been dashed, Jaime finds an ancient scarab that turns out to be an alien symbiote. When the scarab chooses him, Jaime becomes the third incarnation of the superhero, The Blue Beetle. This film is a superhero movie based on the DC comic of the same name. (Repeat).

programme.title: Something's Gotta Give
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton are dynamic in this witty romantic comedy. Nicholson plays an aging Lothario with a young girlfriend. He meets his soul mate, however, when he's introduced to his lover's mother, a playwright who can't stand the sight of him. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Computer whizzes toil away at a tech company in California and hope their ideas will be the Next Big Thing in this comedy, which begins with Richard being courted by Hooli honcho Gavin Belson and eccentric investor Peter Gregory when they see dollar signs in his new Web site, but for entirely different reasons. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: A viable business plan that includes staff reductions is required by Peter Gregory before he'll come through with the start-up money, but Richard isn't sure if his best friend, Big Head, will make the cut. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Gavin Belson promotes Nucleus, a competing compression platform, but Richard is preoccupied with negotiating for Pied Piper, which is already registered to a sprinkler company. Meanwhile, Erlich tries to come up with a new name for the business; and Peter Gregory displays his stingy side. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard regrets his drunken promise at Peter's toga party to make Erlich a board member, and later works on a presentation for Pied Piper's vision. Meanwhile, Big Head finds kindred spirits after being unassigned at Hooli; and an interesting connection emerges between Peter and Gavin Belson. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Erlich taps a graffiti artist to design Pied Piper's logo, with predictably controversial results. Meanwhile, Richard learns he doesn't have much time to prepare for a live demonstration at TechCrunch Disrupt; Gavin Belson and Peter Gregory have an unexpected encounter; and Jared works on the company's efficiency. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Pied Piper's cloud needs help, so the team hire a hacker called "The Carver," though his notorious reputation makes Richard nervous. Meanwhile, Jared goes out of his way to get Peter Gregory's signature; Gilfoyle's girlfriend attracts attention in the incubator; and Dinesh faces a sexual dilemma. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: TechCrunch Disrupt opens and Richard worries about finishing his demo, but is distracted by a former girlfriend who's spreading rumors about him. Meanwhile, Jared feels threatened by Amanda's role in the company; Dinesh is smitten with a woman at another booth; and Pied Piper's chances may be ruined by Erlich's connection to a judge that's rooted in scandal. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: In the Season 1 finale, Pied Piper's guys are worried after Gavin Belson gives a stirring presentation at TechCrunch Disrupt, but Richard finds the inspiration to make significant changes while Jared plots a new direction for the company. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nikki Glaser: Someday You'll Die
programme.desc: Taped in December 2023 in front of a sold-out audience at the Moore Theater in Seattle, Washington, Glaser dives into a wide range of topics including why she doesn't want kids, the harsh realities of aging, her sexual fantasies, and plans for her own death – all in her hilarious, unapologetic, and brutally honest style. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Polished and incisive remake of the 1939 classic about a sisterhood of well-to-do New Yorkers who rally around their friend (Meg Ryan) when they learn her husband is having an affair. As in the original, the film features an all-female cast, including Annette Bening, Jada Pinkett Smith, Eva Mendes and Debra Messing. Written and directed by TV veteran Diane English, who based her script on the 1936 play by Clare Boothe Luce. Rolling Stone Mick Jagger is one of the producers. (Repeat).

programme.title: Problemista
programme.desc: A young immigrant from El Salvador is facing his last month in the United States unless he can find a sponsor. Living in New York City has been tough as his career as a toy creator has not gone to plan. At the eleventh hour, he finds a unique artist who may become his sponsor—as long as he helps her with her next exhibition. (Repeat).

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Disaster Artist
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy-drama based on actual events, weirdo auteur Tommy Wiseau befriends struggling actor Greg Sestero. Together, they make a movie called "The Room," which soon becomes a cult hit due to its staggering badness. (Repeat).

programme.title: Seth Meyers: Dad Man Walking
programme.desc: ​Emmy-winning writer, New York Times bestselling author, and SNL alum Seth Meyers stars in his first HBO stand-up special. Known for his dry wit and sharp topical commentary as host of Late Night with Seth Meyers, the comedian shifts his focus to his personal life – from the chaos of raising three young kids, to navigating different communication styles in marriage, and more. (Repeat).

programme.title: Amanda Seales: I Be Knowin'
programme.desc: In her HBO debut, Amanda Seales humorously explores social norms and personal identity, engaging the audience with her unique perspective. (Repeat).

programme.title: Barry Munday
programme.desc: Barry Munday (Patrick Wilson) wakes up in the hospital after an attack in a movie theater minus his testicles. Then he discovers that a woman whom he can't remember sleeping with has filed a paternity suit against him. (Repeat).

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: A rollicking adventure about a mail-room clerk who finds himself shipwrecked on an island inhabited by a minuscule race of people, who make him look like a giant by comparison. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: This fantasy musical film follows the story of Willy Wonka, the famous but eccentric chocolatier based on the character from Roald Dahl's novel. In particular, it emphasizes his rise to the top. The narrative traces his beginnings as a young adult who started as an employee selling chocolate in a store until he became driven to enter the chocolate industry eventually. This film acts as a prequel to the 1971 film adaptation of Dahl's novel. (Repeat).

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best. (Repeat).

programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.desc: Ordinary teen Billy Batson possesses the ability to transform into a superhero alter ego with just a single word. As Batson continues to hone his crimefighting skills and tackle new challenges, he faces a threat that puts his life in jeopardy. The sequel to the 2019 film. (Repeat).

programme.title: Leo Reich: Literally Who Cares?!
programme.desc: Leo Reich faces the swirling uncertainty of our collective future, asking the big questions. Treading the line between hilarious stand-up and humorless performance art, this special blends songs, anecdotes, and anxious non-sequiturs in a valiant attempt to raise awareness about important social and political causes or something. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Season 2 begins with the Pied Piper guys being wined and dined by every venture capitalist under the sun, while Monica adjusts to a new managing partner at Raviga as the company faces major changes. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Pied Piper could go under if Richard and the guys can't find legal and financial help in the wake of Hooli's bombshell. Meanwhile, Dinesh tries to thwart a fund-raising campaign for his cousin's new app; and Monica tries to keep her interest in Pied Piper separate from her job. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard mulls a proposal by Gavin, but also considers a pitch from Russ Hanneman about backing Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Monica learns surprising news about Richard's deal with Hooli; and Gilfoyle and Dinesh go to extremes to get what they want. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard clashes with Erlich over a potential employee; Jared draws up a workplace harassment policy; Dinesh and Gilfoyle wonder if a new coworker they recommended is making more money than they are; Monica and Richard are outvoted at a board meeting; Big Head gets a promotion at Hooli. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Gavin creates interference that hinders Pied Piper's expansion. Meanwhile, the guys could be threatened by a nosy neighbor; Guilfoyle sets out to build servers; Richard's reluctant to let Jared move in; and Big Head's leadership skills are suspect. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Erlich runs into an old protégé who's now an energy drink billionaire when Monica urges the guys to pursue a livestream opportunity, but Richard learns their friendship isn't what Erlich thinks it is. Meanwhile, Jared wants Carla and Monica to be friends. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: The team fields job offers and Russ is distracted by financial news, but Richard realizes Pied Piper could fold if it doesn't merge with a hated rival. Meanwhile, Dinesh tries to woo a woman online; and Gavin looks on the bright side of Nucleus' failure. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard gets paranoid about security after he takes pity on a competitor and inadvertently starts a feud. Meanwhile, Russ is ready to celebrate Pied Piper's latest gambit; and Gavin looks for a scapegoat when he feels pressure from board members. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Erlich wants to testify when Pied Piper and Hooli enter binding arbitration, but Richard worries that his rival's claims could have merit. Meanwhile, Jared, Dinesh and Gilfoyle debate a philosophical theory; and Big Head gets a boost. (Repeat).

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: In the Season 2 finale, the verdict on Pied Piper's fate coincides with a startling real-life drama that makes their livestream immensely popular, and emotions run high as the gang tries to keep the company together. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: Bridget Jones, now a fortysomething news producer, discovers that she's pregnant in this hilarious comedy sequel. However, she isn't sure if the baby's father is Mark Darcy, her on-and-off boyfriend, or Jack Qwant, her new American love interest. (Repeat).

programme.title: Amelie
programme.desc: At a tiny Parisian café, the adorable yet painfully shy Amélie accidentally discovers a gift for helping others. Soon Amelie is spending her days as a matchmaker, guardian angel, and all-around do-gooder. But when she bumps into a handsome stranger, will she find the courage to become the star of her very own love story? (Repeat).

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: This gripping and transcendent epic adaptation of the classic graphic novel is set in 1985 America, where a cadre of forced-into-retirement superheroes investigate the murder of one of their own and uncover a wide-ranging conspiracy. The dark and visually stunning adventure was directed by Zack Snyder, who deemed his film version "a separate artistic experience from the book." (Repeat).

programme.title: 3 Days to Kill
programme.desc: An ex-Secret Service agent sets out on one last mission in exchange for an experimental drug that could save his life in this high-flying thriller. Meanwhile, he is tasked with looking after his estranged daughter as the drug's debilitating side effects begin to take hold. (Repeat).

programme.title: Open Water
programme.desc: Minimalist, edge-of-your-seat thriller about a couple accidentally left at sea in shark-infested waters during a scuba-diving excursion. (Repeat).

programme.title: Open Water 2: Adrift
programme.desc: A seafaring birthday celebration takes a turn for the terrifying when the passengers of a luxury yacht forget to lower the automated ladder before jumping into the ocean for a playful swim. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Farewell
programme.desc: After her beloved grandmother is diagnosed with terminal cancer, a Chinese-American woman returns to China for a family gathering secretly designed to say goodbye to the matriarch. However, when it becomes apparent that grandma is the only one unaware of the diagnosis, she struggles to keep the secret. (Repeat).

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: A Massachusetts wife and mother (Hilary Swank) dedicates her life to becoming a lawyer in hopes of exonerating her imprisoned brother (Sam Rockwell), whom she believes was wrongfully convicted of a murder in this electrifying drama directed by Tony Goldwyn. (Repeat).

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: This stunning sci-fi sequel finds the nations of Earth banding together to fight off a second alien invasion, 20 years after the first attack brought humanity to the brink of extinction. Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the alliance readies itself for a massive war. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Shortly after Caesar's murder, Octavian devises a plan to keep his family from fleeing the city, news that Antony happily delivers to a nervous Brutus. Meanwhile, Vorenus mourns Niobe's death but curses his children, and Pullo and Eirene get married without knowing what's happened back in Rome. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Octavian's endless demands for his inheritance rankle Antony, who is distracted by a visit from Cleopatra; Vorenus is ordered to quell the chaos among the Aventine merchants that he helped create by killing Erastes; Timon is surprised by his brother's arrival from Jerusalem. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.sub-title: These Being the Words of Marcus Tullius Cicero
programme.desc: Pullo tries in vain to persuade Vorenus to prevent a war among Aventine gangs; Antony's designs on Gaul elicit a shocking proclamation from Cicero to the Senate; Servilia enlists the opportunistic Duro to end an old feud; Brutus wrestles with his demons while seeking support in Bithynia. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.sub-title: Testudo et Lepus (The Tortoise and the Hare)
programme.desc: Pullo races to find Vorenus with news of the fate of his children; Servilia pays a price for trying to eliminate a rival; a victorious Octavian sends word he's returning to Rome with his army, which comes as a surprise to Cicero; Timon grows weary of doing his mistress's bidding. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: After his adventures with Antony and Pullo, Vorenus comes back to face the merchants of the Aventine Collegium; a pair of former foes reconcile their differences. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Vorenus is ordered to prune the ranks of Rome's elite; Brutus and Cassius prepare to face the recently allied Octavian and Antony in the Battle of Philippi; Levi and Timon create mayhem at a synagogue; Pullo thwarts Cicero's attempt to warn Brutus. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Antony's old ways resurface to test his recent alliance with Octavian; Timon and Levi devise a plan to thwart Herod's schemes; Atia is unnerved by Servilia's public displays of grief; Gaia uses Pullo's punishment against him; Vorenus is suspicious of his daughter's sudden interest in his business; Posca gets married. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Octavian's campaign for a more virtuous society hits hardest in his inner circle; Vorenus's efforts to solve a gold robbery leave a bitter taste of betrayal; Pullo turns his grief about a personal loss into anger at a new enemy; Timon leaves Rome with his family for Jerusalem. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.sub-title: Deus Impetitio Esuritori Nullus (No God Can Stop a Hungry Man)
programme.desc: A shortage of grain in Rome leads to another potential conflict between Octavian and a stubborn Antony; Pullo's food rationing in the Collegium spreads panic among the citizens; Posca returns from Egypt with good news for Octavian. (Repeat).

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: In the series finale, Antony returns to Alexandria after the Battle of Actium. His retreat into revelry with Cleopatra is interrupted by the arrival of Octavian, who orders Pullo to find Vorenus and his young traveling companion. (Repeat).

programme.title: Bodies Bodies Bodies
programme.desc: As an intense tropical storm bears down on a remote family estate, a cohort of privileged, out-of-touch twenty-somethings plans to spare no expense for an explosive party. Yet, their evening of drunken merriment soon takes a sinister turn when an innocent game yields fatal consequences, all the while exposing the fake personalities that lie beneath the friends' carefully curated exteriors. (Repeat).

programme.title: This Place Rules
programme.desc: Andrew Callaghan explore the undercurrents that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot. As one of the best-known and hardest working journalists of his generation, the 25-year-old ventures on a wild RV journey through America to take the pulse of a divided nation. In 2020, as COVID rages, protests sweep the country, and a monumental election looms, Callaghan captures the chaos in the streets and a wide spectrum of views – with just a camera and a microphone. (Repeat).

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: In this high-octane thrill ride set in a sun-parched, postapocalyptic future, loner Max gets caught up in the plight of a group of warrior women as they flee from an evil despot across a desert wasteland. (Repeat).

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: The historical war drama follows multiple families seeking survival in 1860s America. In the backdrop of the Civil War (1861-1865), the allure of the Old West beckons families shattered by war. The Old West is a harsh paradise built on blood, sweat, and the tears of unlikely allies. Through intertwined tales of families, friends, and foes, the struggle for identity and belonging unfolds. (Repeat).

programme.title: Smoking Tigers
programme.desc: This coming-of-age drama follows the story of Hayoung as she navigates her new life during the 2000s in Los Angeles. Of Korean-American descent, she is still affected by the separation of her parents while trying to be a strong big sister to her younger sister. As the sixteen-year-old starts school in a new elite institution, she encounters new challenges in balancing her exposure to wealthy friends at school and enacting her low-income home realities. (Repeat).

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This fascinating reimagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the scientist builds an undead creature that turns dangerous, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself. (Repeat).

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Director M. Night Shyamalan followed the chilling "The Sixth Sense" with this riveting thriller. Bruce Willis is security guard David Dunn, who survives a devastating train wreck miraculously unharmed. The owner (Samuel L. Jackson) of a comic-book art gallery sees him as a mysterious protector with a higher calling, but Dunn is doubtful. Robin Wright Penn, Spencer Treat Clark, Eamonn Walker. (Repeat).

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: Thrills and laughs go hand in hand as a single woman and a spy elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry, while a CIA director tries to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. (Repeat).

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this wild and anarchic "super-antihero" film, a team of incarcerated villains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences. (Repeat).

actor.role: Dr Harleen F. Quinzel / Harley Quinn

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: A psychotic killer chains two men together and forces them to make horrific choices to win their freedom in this spellbinding thriller reminiscent of "Seven." Leigh Whannell, Cary Elwes, Danny Glover, Ken Leung, Dina Meyer, Mike Butters, Paul Gutrecht. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: A police detective captures the serial killer known as "Jigsaw," only to learn that he has just set up a new scenario involving eight people trapped in a house full of nerve gas. This terrifying chiller is a sequel to the 2004 sleeper hit. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw III
programme.desc: In this terrifying sequel, the police continue their hunt for the torture master Jigsaw, who is now terminally ill but has a crazed female apprentice to continue his sadistic games. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw IV
programme.desc: The terrifying horror franchise continues with this latest installment revolving around an abducted cop and the hunt for a killer who is continuing the deadly legacy of Jigsaw and his protégé. Tobin Bell, Costas Mandylor, Scott Patterson, Betsy Russell, Lyriq Bent, Athena Karkanis. Directed by Darren Lynn Bousman. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw V
programme.desc: The frightfully unnerving fifth entry in the popular, long-running slasher series finds serial killer Jigsaw dead (or is he?) and his sadistic successor continuing with his diabolical, torturing ways. Costas Mandylor, Tobin Bell, Julie Benz, Donnie Wahlberg, Betsy Russell, Scott Patterson, Meagan Good, Greg Bryk. Directed by David Hackl, who was the production designer on "Saw II," "Saw III" and "Saw IV," as well as second-unit director on "Saw III" and "Saw IV." (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw VI
programme.desc: In the shocking sixth entry in one of the biggest horror franchises of all time, detective Hoffman continues the work of serial killer Jigsaw by setting up fiendishly complex traps for his victims. Meanwhile, the FBI closes in and Jigsaw's grand scheme finally comes into focus. (Repeat).

programme.title: Saw VII: The Final Chapter
programme.desc: In this terrifying installment of the hugely popular horror series, the surviving victims of Jigsaw consult a self-help guru (Sean Patrick Flanery), whose dark secrets end up causing as much carnage as the killer himself. Directed by Kevin Greutert. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: Terror comes at a frightening clip when a group of teens have a close brush with death at a racetrack, only to find the Grim Reaper striking back at them with a vengeance. (Repeat).

programme.title: I Am
programme.desc: Successful 30-something Hannah must deal with an unexpected crisis. (Repeat).

programme.title: I Am
programme.desc: The story of a single mother of two who is fighting to keep her family stable in a precarious world, and the sacrifices that she has to make to survive. When Kirsty is left with spiraling debts by her ex-partner who has vanished, she meets a neighbor, Ryan, who offers to help her out of the hole that she's in. But all is not as it seems, forcing Kirsty into some dark and desperate decisions; an abyss that seems to have no way out. (Repeat).

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: In this breathtaking epic, English adventurer John Smith finds love with Pocahontas after arriving in America and being pardoned from a death sentence. Meanwhile, European settlers establish a shaky truce with the Native Americans. (Repeat).

programme.title: Cyrus
programme.desc: In this offbeat comedy, divorcé John (John C. Reilly) hits it off with a pretty woman (Marisa Tomei) at a party. They begin a relationship, but her adult son Cyrus (Jonah Hill) has a profound attachment to her and he wants John out of her life. Directed by the Duplass brothers. (Repeat).

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: In this superhero stunner, after being sent to Earth from planet Krypton by his parents with a special object from his home planet in tow, Clark Kent grows up with the help of his earthly adopted parents and later assumes the identity of Superman and sets out to defend Earth from the villainous General Zod. (Repeat).

programme.title: Braddock: Missing in Action III
programme.desc: Chuck Norris invades Vietnam again to rescue a wife he thought dead and a son he didn't know he had. Quoc: Aki Aleong. Tan Cang: Roland Harrah III. Lin: Miki Kim. Polanski: Yehuda Efroni. Directed by Aaron Norris. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: In the opener of this seven-part miniseries about an elite Marine unit in the first weeks of the Iraq War, the diverse members of the First Recon Battalion await orders to invade at Camp Mathilda in Kuwait in 2003. Based on the book by Evan Wright, a reporter who was embedded with the unit as they crossed the border. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: With the invasion of Iraq now in full swing, Sgt. Colbert tries to keep his unit focused. First Recon Marines adjust to shifting attack plans while anticipating their first contact with the enemy in Nasiriyah and Al Gharraf. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: The "Godfather" orders Bravo Company to travel 40 kilometers to secure an Iraqi airfield, believed to be controlled by the Republican Guard, in advance of British paratroopers. But the mission is marred by a "friendly fire" attack on a supply convoy and Trombley's overzealous reaction to a change in the rules of engagement, which results in a desperate request being sent up the chain of command. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: Grumbling in the ranks about the abandoned supply truck occupies time to kill at the captured airfield, but Bravo is soon on the move again, heading north, clearing villages and setting up a roadblock outside Al Hayy. Meanwhile, Alpha is ordered to find the body of a marine in Al Shatra, but their mission is delayed by a CIA operation. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: Despite an armored division's punishing response to 1st Recon's intelligence-gathering about an ambush-in-waiting at a strategic bridge, Bravo still meets stiff resistance while making several attempts to cross it; a survey of the battlefield prompts more questions than answers about the enemy; a roadblock in Al Muwaffiqiyah tests the Marines' ever-changing rules of engagement. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: After First Recon is assigned the unfamiliar mission of escorting hundreds of civilians fleeing Baghdad, they begin to wonder if their part in the war may be ending. But the Godfather has other plans to get his men back into the battle. (Repeat).

programme.title: Generation Kill
programme.desc: In the series finale, Bravo arrives in Baghdad, where they do their best to address a restless population's concerns about food, water, medicine and electricity shortages. Meanwhile, a departing Scribe discusses recent events with the Godfather, and tempers flare during a football game at an abandoned Iraqi army base. (Repeat).

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Director M. Night Shyamalan followed the chilling "The Sixth Sense" with this riveting thriller. Bruce Willis is security guard David Dunn, who survives a devastating train wreck miraculously unharmed. The owner (Samuel L. Jackson) of a comic-book art gallery sees him as a mysterious protector with a higher calling, but Dunn is doubtful. Robin Wright Penn, Spencer Treat Clark, Eamonn Walker. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tell
programme.desc: Small-time crook Ethan Tell makes a big-time score when he and his wife succeed in pulling off a million dollar heist, while also leaving their co-conspirators with nothing. But Ethan's luck changes when he's caught by police. (Repeat).

programme.title: Midsommar
programme.desc: Just as their relationship is on the brink of falling apart, couple Dani and Christian are brought closer by a family tragedy. The mourning Dani then joins Christian and his friends, Josh and Mark, on a trip to a rural Swedish village that is celebrating a once-in-a-blue-moon festival. As the tourists partake in the celebrations, they discover that the idyllic community holds many unnerving secrets, and it all unfolds in broad daylight. (Repeat).

programme.title: Stopping The Steal
programme.desc: An inside account of President Trump's challenge to the results of the 2020 presidential election as told by former White House staff and appointees, including former Attorney General William Barr, and elected Republican officials in Arizona and Georgia who resisted pressure to change the results of the vote in their states. (Repeat).

programme.title: Southside With You
programme.desc: Touching docudrama about Barack Obama's first date with Michelle Robinson, his future wife, during the summer of 1989 in Chicago. (Repeat).

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: If you thought Harry Potter was cool, just wait until you meet Darren Shan (Chris Massoglia)! After being turned into a vampire, Darren joins a traveling freak show and attempts to stop a war between the vampires and their bitter rivals, the Vampanese. John C. Reilly, Willem Dafoe, Salma Hayek. (Repeat).

programme.title: Need for Speed
programme.desc: In this intense thrill ride, street-racing mechanic Tobey embarks on a cross-country mission of vengeance against shady ex-NASCAR driver Dino, who framed him for a crime he didn't commit. Now, Tobey must defeat Dino in a major underground race with the help of Julia, an ingenious car broker. (Repeat).

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL." (Repeat).

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: In this thrilling and intelligent Best Picture nominee, Bruce Willis gives a finely nuanced performance as a child psychologist; the superb Haley Joel Osment costars as his tormented patient, who has visions of the dead. (Repeat).

programme.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
programme.desc: Hugh Jackman once again takes on the role of Wolverine in this thrilling prequel to the "X-Men" movie series. This origin story explains how Wolverine discovered his unique powers and the mysterious circumstances behind his retractable metal claws. Fanboys will cheer at the introduction of many characters made famous in the "X-Men" comics, including Sabretooth. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: In this explosive thriller, a team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed during a mission by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric). But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (Repeat).

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Cautionary tale about inner-city hopelessness, focusing on a 12-year-old drug carrier and his struggle for survival on Brooklyn streets. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A woman acts as a nanny for a life-size doll, which a couple are using as a coping mechanism for the death of their son two decades earlier. However, she soon suspects that there is more to the doll than meets the eye in this disturbing horror film. (Repeat).

programme.title: Singularity
programme.desc: In 2020, a supercomputer determines that human beings pose the greatest threat to Earth, and begins an eradication process. Decades later, a teen struggles to survive in a world dominated by machines in this haunting sci-fi thriller. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Current War
programme.desc: Electricity kingpins George Westinghouse and Thomas Edison find their rivalry escalating, plunging deeper into a brutal race to electrify the United States. Loyalties are tested and lines are crossed as the magnates vie to exert their influence across the nation and also bring their patented electrical system to the entire modern world. (Repeat).

programme.title: Echo In the Canyon
programme.desc: This documentary explores the musical legacy of Laurel Canyon: a mountainous neighbourhood in the Hollywood Hills region that became a countercultural hub in the 1960s and early 1970s. It pays tribute to the enduring influence of West Coast music icons such as The Beach Boys, Buffalo Springfield, and The Mamas and the Papas. (Repeat).

programme.title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence
programme.desc: The minds of two cinematic geniuses meld in this visionary sci-fi epic directed by Steven Spielberg and based on a treatment by Stanley Kubrick. Haley Joel Osment is extraordinary as a robot programmed to have human emotions. After he is abandoned by his adoptive parents, he sets out to become a real boy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Raging Grace
programme.desc: The thriller follows an undocumented immigrant from the Philippines named Joy. She is struggling to make a living to support her daughter in the United Kingdom. One day, Joy finds a well-paying job as a caretaker for a rich old man afflicted by a terminal disease. Soon, Joy finds out that the old man hides many dark secrets that can ruin everything she worked hard for. (Repeat).

programme.title: Scream VI
programme.desc: Bored of the quaint town of Woodsboro, the notorious serial killer Ghostface leaves his small-town stomping grounds behind, pursuing more ambitious conquests in New York City. Determined to overthrow his reign of terror once and for all, a cohort of familiar faces returns to seek justice for the bloodshed. The sixth installment in the horror franchise. (Repeat).

programme.title: Adult World
programme.desc: In this bitingly funny look at twentysomething life, a floundering college graduate reluctantly takes a job at a sex shop in Upstate New York as she seeks an apprenticeship that could help launch her career as a poet. Meanwhile, she finds love and inspiration in the last place she ever expected. (Repeat).

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: An urban teen moves to a rural Midwestern town where dancing is outlawed and fights to stage a high-school prom complete with dancing. He also falls for a local girl whose minister dad is behind the dirty dancing boycott. (Repeat).

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: When Michael Harding returns home from military school, he clashes with his new stepfather in this intense thriller. Michael begins to suspect that his mom's new husband might be a notorious serial killer who preys on broken families. (Repeat).

programme.title: Men, Women & Children
programme.desc: A dissatisfied husband and wife both look for lovers online in this sprawling, timely drama about the Internet's impact on society. Elsewhere, a woman pushes her daughter's acting career via a Web site, and an overprotective mom monitors her child's online interactions. (Repeat).

programme.title: Go
programme.desc: A supermarket clerk sells drugs to cover her rent in this wild, three-pronged comedy about young Los Angelenos involved in sex, drugs and crime over the course of 24 hours. Meanwhile, friends live it up in Vegas and two actors are busted by a cop. (Repeat).

programme.title: Weiner
programme.desc: This riveting behind-the-scenes documentary follows former congressman Anthony Weiner as he runs for mayor of New York City in 2013. During the campaign, he becomes embroiled in a second widely publicized sexting scandal, which ultimately derails his once-promising political career. (Repeat).

programme.title: Teaching Mrs. Tingle
programme.desc: A manipulative high-school teacher is held hostage by three students. (Repeat).

programme.title: Nana's Boys
programme.desc: Nana's Boys focuses on the intimate life of a couple who are confronted with the fact that their relationship is not as solid as they thought. (Repeat).

programme.title: Memory
programme.desc: This drama follows Sylvia, a single mother who works as a social worker and a care worker. She has been sober for 13 years and is quietly raising her teen daughter, Anna, in Brooklyn. She finds herself attending her high school reunion where she encounters his schoolmate, Saul. She is creeped out when he follows her home from the reunion, but later discovers that Saul has early onset dementia. Saul's brother eventually hires her as Saul's caretaker. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Faculty
programme.desc: High schoolers face an onslaught of aliens who have taken over the bodies of their teachers. (Repeat).

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A shy teenager, dominated by a religiously fanatic mother, suffers at the hands of high-school bullies, whose mean pranks rile the teen into discovering she has telekinetic powers, which she uses to take ultimate revenge at the prom. (Repeat).

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: In this rousing coming-of-age tale, a second-string high-school quarterback (James Van Der Beek) replaces the injured starter. At first, the quarterback revels in his new role, but then, his relaxed attitude causes problems with his gung-ho coach (Jon Voight). Paul Walker, Rob Lester, Scott Caan, Richard Lineback, Ali Larter, Tiffany C. Love. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sick of Myself
programme.desc: Signe is a woman with an active competition going on with her own boyfriend, Thomas. Their toxic relationship is characterized by attempts at passive-aggressive acts that aim to garner the most attention. Trouble begins when Thomas becomes notoriously famous for creating avant-garde artworks from stolen objects. Not to be outdone, Signe takes pills dangerous to her health in an attempt to steal the spotlight. (Repeat).

programme.title: Showing Up
programme.desc: Lizzy, an introverted and introspective sculptor, works tirelessly to prepare a new collection for an upcoming gallery show. As she strives to invest her creative energy into her art, she must continually work to manage the complex dynamics of her eclectic, melodramatic inner circle of family and friends. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Cookout
programme.desc: A fine cast cooks up funny performances in this hilarious urban comedy. When a basketball player (Storm P) signs a $30 million contract, he invites friends and family from the 'hood to a cookout at his estate. But the barbecue doesn't go as planned, as the rich sports star deals with gold diggers, agents, stuffy neighbors and a wacky security guard (writer-producer Queen Latifah). Tim Meadows, Danny Glover, Farrah Fawcett, Ja Rule. (Repeat).

programme.title: All the Wrong Ingredients
programme.desc: Desperate to win a high-stakes dessert contest, chef Ben unintentionally cooks up an imaginary friend to help him reinvent the meaning of delicious. But what happens when his ambition becomes a monster? (Repeat).

programme.title: The Collective
programme.desc: The action film tells the story of a highly secretive agency of righteous assassins seeking justice for all. The agency targets a human trafficking ring. They soon find out that the ring's operations are managed by billionaires who live above the law. A new agency recruit helps the assassins take down the ring with his unconventional skillset. (Repeat).

programme.title: Chloe
programme.desc: In this erotically charged drama, Catherine (Julianne Moore) suspects her husband David (Liam Neeson) may be cheating on her, so she hires a prostitute named Chloe (Amanda Seyfried) to flirt with him and report back to her about how he responds. However, Catherine eventually finds herself drawn to Chloe and the stories she shares of her erotic encounters with David. (Repeat).

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: In the Coen brothers' stirring remake of the John Wayne classic, an alcoholic U.S. Marshal and an independent-minded 14-year-old girl track down her father's killer with the help of a Texas Ranger. As the three brave dangerous Indian territory, they discover their prey has fallen in with a more-experienced criminal. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Last Voyage of the Demeter
programme.desc: In the late nineteenth century, the Russian schooner Demeter embarks on an unusual quest, carrying twenty-four unmarked crates from Carpathia to London. Their voyage seems doomed from the start, given their suspicious orders, as a malevolent presence preys upon each member of the crew. When the ship arrives, at last, in Whitby Harbour, the crew is nowhere to be found. The story is based on a chapter from Bram Stoker's Dracula. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Best friends Wayne and Garth are hired to host their public access show professionally. Wayne falls for Cassandra, the lead singer in a metal band, and must contend with a handsome network executive who plans to ruin their show and steal away Cassandra. Based on the iconic SNL skit. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Integrity of Joseph Chambers
programme.desc: Struggling with feelings of inadequacy, an ordinary man vows to prove his masculinity and ability to provide for his family by embarking on a solo off-the-grid expedition in the woods to hunt for deer. As he ventures deeper into the forest, he soon realizes he wanders deeper into his own psyche and the root of his motivations. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Addams Family
programme.desc: A stranger shows up on the Addams' doorstep, claiming to be a long-lost uncle. However, he is really a ringer in cahoots with a lawyer; and the two are trying to dupe the ghoulish family out of their fortune. (Repeat).

programme.title: Addams Family Values
programme.desc: The spooky clan welcome a newborn and hire a bachelor-murdering nanny who's out to inherit Uncle Fester's fortune. Wednesday and Pugsley are on to her, so she convinces Gomez and Morticia to send them away to an inane summer camp. (Repeat).

programme.title: Talk To Me
programme.desc: A group of friends plays a dangerous game against the spirit world. After stumbling on an embalmed hand, the group figures out how to use it to conjure spirits. Consumed by this thrilling new power to communicate with the dead, they unlock the spirit world and must face the deadly consequences. (Repeat).

programme.title: Foxcatcher
programme.desc: Riveting docudrama about millionaire John du Pont and his relationship with brothers Dave and Mark Schultz, Olympic wrestlers who train at his estate. Mark initially idolizes du Pont, but slowly realizes the depths of his benefactor's madness. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Social Network
programme.desc: In this sweeping tale of Internet success, nerdy, awkward Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the Web site Facebook and becomes a billionaire, but ends up embroiled in legal disputes as the friends who helped him during his rise to the top are now eager to see him fall. (Repeat).

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: Jack Black earned a Golden Globe nomination for his inspired performance in Richard Linklater's whimsical comedy. He plays a manic slacker-turned-substitute teacher who transforms his sheltered private-school pupils into a full-fledged rock band. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tale of Tales
programme.desc: In this sublime adaptation of three 17th-century Italian fairy tales about troubled royals, a queen conceives a child by eating a monster's heart, a king grows obsessed with a pet flea and a ruler is bewitched by a woman with a beautiful singing voice. (Repeat).

programme.title: Anything for Fame
programme.desc: Documentary profile of a new breed of ambitious content creators. (Repeat).

programme.title: Colewell
programme.desc: Nora Pancowski, the postmaster of Colewell, Pennsylvania, has held her post for over three decades. However, her career is put into jeopardy when the USPS makes a move to shut her office down. Pancowski is thus tasked with a significant decision of finding work in a new location or retiring completely so as to remain in Colewell. (Repeat).

programme.title: DIO: Dreamers Never Die
programme.desc: This career spanning documentary on heavy metal legend Ronnie James Dio delves deep into his incredible rise from 50's doo-wop crooner, to his early classic rock days in Ritchie Blackmore's Rainbow, to replacing the iconic lead singer Ozzy Osborne in Black Sabbath, to finally cement his legend with DIO. Ronnie's biography is completely unique to the tired sex, drugs and rock and roll cliches. The film is about perseverance, dreams and the power to believe in yourself. (Repeat).

programme.title: On the Edge
programme.desc: One night, Leo, a Spaniard working in Brussels as a subway driver, sees a young man on the edge of the platform, just before he falls onto the tracks. (Repeat).

programme.title: Pirates
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve 1999, three friends, who are attempting to break into the music scene through pirate radio, drive through London in a desperate search for tickets for the best millennium party ever. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Starling Girl
programme.desc: Jem Starling is a seventeen-year-old girl living in a Christian fundamentalist community ruled by tradition and religion. When youth pastor Owen makes a surprising return to the local church, the teenage girl faces a challenging time navigating her feelings and values. (Repeat).

programme.title: In a Relationship
programme.desc: This romantic comedy satirizes L.A. dating culture by juxtaposing two millennial couples at different relationship stages. Each couple explores different romantic challenges, romantic expectations, and relationship dynamics throughout the summer of 2016. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Stepfather
programme.desc: When Michael Harding returns home from military school, he clashes with his new stepfather in this intense thriller. Michael begins to suspect that his mom's new husband might be a notorious serial killer who preys on broken families. (Repeat).

programme.title: Blinded by the Light
programme.desc: A second-generation British-Pakistani teenager comes of age in a small town during the Thatcher era, rebelling against parental and cultural expectations and the confines of provincial life with the help of Bruce Springsteen's empowering music and relatable lyricism. (Repeat).

programme.title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence
programme.desc: The minds of two cinematic geniuses meld in this visionary sci-fi epic directed by Steven Spielberg and based on a treatment by Stanley Kubrick. Haley Joel Osment is extraordinary as a robot programmed to have human emotions. After he is abandoned by his adoptive parents, he sets out to become a real boy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Tale of Tales
programme.desc: In this sublime adaptation of three 17th-century Italian fairy tales about troubled royals, a queen conceives a child by eating a monster's heart, a king grows obsessed with a pet flea and a ruler is bewitched by a woman with a beautiful singing voice. (Repeat).

programme.title: You Hurt My Feelings
programme.desc: Beth is a novelist whose recent publication, a memoir, seems to have struck the wrong notes with her fans, yielding lukewarm reviews and sales. Meanwhile, her therapist husband, Don, contends with feelings of discontentment. When Beth eavesdrops on Don confessing his true feelings about her memoir, their long-term marriage soon begins to crumble. (Repeat).

programme.title: Camp X-Ray
programme.desc: A small-town girl joins the military and becomes a guard at Guantanamo Bay, where she forges a delicate, transformative bond with an inmate who raises some compelling questions about his incarceration in this powerful drama. (Repeat).

programme.title: Get Over It
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst stars in this charming teen romance about a guy (Ben Foster) who tries to win back his girlfriend by getting a part in the school play. With the help of a friend (Dunst), he hones his acting skills and discovers the meaning of true love. Sisqo, Martin Short, Melissa Sagemiller, Shane West, Colin Hanks, Mila Kunis. (Repeat).

programme.title: Anesthesia
programme.desc: A professor is stabbed near his NYC apartment in this deeply humane ensemble drama. Elsewhere, his daughter-in-law battles cancer, a student of his has self-harm issues, a junkie is dragged to rehab and a suburban wife longs for the city. (Repeat).

programme.title: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
programme.desc: Best Actor Oscar nominee Johnny Depp perfectly embodies the title role in Tim Burton's bloody well-done adaptation of the Stephen Sondheim musical about the vengeful owner of a tonsorial parlor that offers customers more than just a shave and a haircut. Helena Bonham Carter costars as Mrs. Lovett, who makes a killing with her new pie recipe containing a special meaty ingredient. (Repeat).

programme.title: Out of Sight
programme.desc: A successful bank robber manages to escape from jail. Outside he becomes involved with the Federal Marshal assigned the task of recapturing him. (Repeat).

programme.title: Jeanne du Barry
programme.desc: In eighteenth century France, ambitious commoner Jeanne Vaubernier captivates the Count du Barry, leveraging her charms for social ascent. When introduced to King Louis XV by the Duke of Richelieu, sparks fly, igniting a passionate affair that revitalizes the monarch and leads to Jeanne becoming his beloved favorite. (Repeat).

programme.title: Labor Day
programme.desc: In this tense, poignant drama, a mentally unstable single mother develops a relationship with an escaped convict over the course of a Labor Day weekend as he hides out in her home. Meanwhile, her young son also begins to bond with the escapee. (Repeat).

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: In this gripping drama, a battered wife goes on the lam with her young daughter, but decides to fight back when her abusive husband tracks them down. (Repeat).

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: A woman is framed for the murder of her husband in this riveting thriller. While in prison, she discovers her husband's alive. Knowing that she can't be tried for the same crime twice, she vows to find him upon her release from jail. (Repeat).

programme.title: American Gigolo
programme.desc: Julian is a stylish and successful male prostitute whose life goes downhill when he's framed for murder after doing a pimp a favor. The only person he can trust is a politician's wife who is frustrated with her husband, and is the only woman he sleeps with who doesn't pay for his services. (Repeat).

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick's final film is an erotic thriller about an affluent married couple who are plunged into a bizarre odyssey of sexual discovery, which leads to a dangerous realm of adulterous gamesmanship between the twosome. (Repeat).

programme.title: Superstar
programme.desc: A mildly hyperactive Catholic schoolgirl tries to find fame as a movie star in order to get the boy she likes to kiss her. This outrageous comedy is based on a recurring sketch from "Saturday Night Live." (Repeat).

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A headstrong military man and a scientist go on a frantic search for stolen nuclear warheads before they fall into the wrong hands in this explosive action thriller. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: In this remarkable tale, a man is born in New Orleans just after World War I, but he is already in his eighties and then proceeds to live his life aging in reverse into the 21st century, experiencing joy and sadness, loves lost and found, and the meaning of timelessness. (Repeat).

programme.title: An Acceptable Loss
programme.desc: A former U.S. security adviser's dark past comes back to haunt her. (Repeat).

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars in this action-packed caper film from director John Frankenheimer. Upon his release from prison, a car thief (Affleck) is drawn into a complex casino heist by a mysterious woman (Charlize Theron) and a sadistic criminal (Gary Sinise). Ehren Kruger wrote the script. Clarence Williams III, Isaac Hayes, Dennis Farina, James Frain, Donal Logue. (Repeat).

programme.title: Truth
programme.desc: Hard-hitting docudrama about the controversial 2004 "60 Minutes" exposé on then-president George W. Bush's military service, and the fallout that producer Mary Mapes and anchor Dan Rather suffered after the validity of key documents was questioned. (Repeat).

programme.title: My One and Only
programme.desc: Renée Zellweger stars as a mother who travels down the East Coast with her children as they look for a wealthy socialite to take care of them in this winning comedy based on a childhood recollection of actor George Hamilton. Logan Lerman, Chris Noth, Steven Weber, Nick Stahl, Kevin Bacon. (Repeat).

programme.title: North of Normal
programme.desc: In the 1970s, the experiences of a little girl, who grows up with her young mother in the commune founded by her hippie grandparents. (Repeat).

programme.title: Elizabethtown
programme.desc: A suicidal sneaker designer heads to Kentucky for his father's funeral and falls for a perky flight attendant along the way. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: Sofia Coppola makes an impressive feature-film directing debut with this haunting adaptation of Jeffrey Eugenides' novel. Kirsten Dunst stars as one of five doomed sisters in 1970s suburbia who become the objects of obsession for a group of boys in their neighborhood. James Woods, Kathleen Turner. (Repeat).

programme.title: Factory Girl
programme.desc: Sienna Miller's bravura turn as wildly popular socialite and 1960s counterculture icon Edie Sedgwick (1943-71) puts the juice in this astounding sex-drugs-and-rock-and-roll biopic. Guy Pearce is equally compelling as Sedgwick's mentor, Andy Warhol, and Hayden Christensen stands out as a Bob Dylan-esque folk rocker with whom she falls in love. Directed by George Hickenlooper from a screenplay by Captain Mauzner. Jimmy Fallon, Beth Grant, Mena Suvari, Tara Summers, James Naughton. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wild Things
programme.desc: A popular high school counselor (Matt Dillon) is charged with raping the most popular girl (Denise Richards) in school---a charge that leads investigators into a bizarre maze of deceit and debauchery. Neve Campbell, Kevin Bacon, Theresa Russell, Daphne Rubin-Vega, Robert Wagner, Bill Murray, Carrie Snodgress, Jeff Perry, Cory Pendergast, Marc Macaulay, Toi Svane. (Repeat).

programme.title: Ain't Them Bodies Saints
programme.desc: In 1970s Texas, a notorious outlaw claims responsibility for his wife's murder of a police officer. Years later, he attempts to break out of prison to reunite with his beloved and their daughter. (Repeat).

programme.title: North of Normal
programme.desc: In the 1970s, the experiences of a little girl, who grows up with her young mother in the commune founded by her hippie grandparents. (Repeat).

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Seven Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Actor went to this magical portrait of Scottish playwright J.M. Barrie. The film chronicles his relationship with a young widow and her sons, which inspired "Peter Pan." (Repeat).

programme.title: Days of Heaven
programme.desc: Terrence Malick's exquisitely filmed tale of three migrants on a Texas farm in 1916. Richard Gere, Brooke Adams, Sam Shepard, Linda Manz, Robert Wilke. (Repeat).

programme.title: My Fair Lady
programme.desc: This Best Picture, a musical reworking of George Bernard Shaw's "Pygmalion," is about a pompous, acid-tongued professor of linguistics (Best Actor Rex Harrison) who tries to refine an ill-mannered, uneducated guttersnipe and pass her off as a princess in six months. The film won a total of eight Oscars. (Repeat).

programme.title: Little Black Book
programme.desc: Brittany Murphy is utterly charming in this winning comedy. She plays an insecure producer who raids her boyfriend's electronic organizer to find out about his romantic past. Unfortunately, she learns much more than she bargained for. Carly Simon contributed to the terrific soundtrack. Holly Hunter, Kathy Bates, Ron Livingston, Julianne Nicholson. (Repeat).

programme.title: She's All That
programme.desc: In this clever teen twist on "Pygmalion," Freddie Prinze Jr. stars as the most popular boy at a snooty L.A. high school, who bets his buddies that he can transform a nerdy girl (Rachael Leigh Cook) into the school prom queen. Matthew Lillard, Paul Walker, Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Kevin Pollak, Kieran Culkin, Elden Ratliff, Anna Paquin. (Repeat).

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: Maggie, a young woman longing to start a family, becomes involved in a complicated love triangle with a struggling novelist and his haughty theorist wife in this winning romantic comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: Jude Law defines charisma in this funny, insightful and sometimes poignant portrait of an unabashed philanderer. Law plays Alfie, a Manhattan chauffeur who begins to reevaluate his shallow ideas about women and romance. The comedy-drama is a remake of the 1966 Michael Caine film of the same name. Marisa Tomei, Susan Sarandon, Jane Krakowski, Nia Long, Omar Epps. (Repeat).

programme.title: Chocolat
programme.desc: An enthralling and bittersweet treat about a mysterious woman who opens a sweets shop in a French town in the late 1950s. She causes a bit of a stir, but before long, her magical concoctions have the locals eating out of her hand. (Repeat).

programme.title: Dream Horse
programme.desc: This comedy film is about Jan Vokes, a Welsh bartender who comes up with the idea of breeding a horse intended for racing. Since she lives in a town that is down on its luck, her neighbors start pitching in and participate in financing for the horse. They see the horse as their chance of redeeming their town and lifting their spirits as it races up the ranks, hopefully to become a champion thoroughbred. Based on a true story. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: Jim Carrey's strong performance drives this inspired satire of the media. He plays the unwitting star of a reality-TV show chronicling his life; Linney costars as his wife; and Ed Harris netted a Best Supporting Actor nomination as the show's director. Peter Weir directed and received an Oscar nomination of his own. Noah Emmerich, Natascha McElhone, Holland Taylor. (Repeat).

programme.title: Soapdish
programme.desc: A stellar cast parodies soap opera in a behind-the-scenes look at the lives and loves of actors on fictional daytime drama "The Sun Also Sets" starring longtime lead Celeste Talbert who copes with unexpected subplots that could sabotage her popularity on the show which is also facing declining ratings. (Repeat).

programme.title: Wild Eyed and Wicked
programme.desc: Lily Pierce is sick of being haunted. She decides to reconnect with her estranged father, a disgraced history professor, and learn how to draw upon a time of steel and blade when armor-clad knights rode out and dueled their monsters to the death. (Repeat).

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: Maggie, a young woman longing to start a family, becomes involved in a complicated love triangle with a struggling novelist and his haughty theorist wife in this winning romantic comedy. (Repeat).

programme.title: All the World is Sleeping
programme.desc: As an engaged couple plans their dream wedding, the groom is excited but doesn't inform his friends he's getting married. Confused by his secrecy, they hatch a plan to find out what he's hiding. Meanwhile, the bride seems withdrawn, and her groom starts worrying if this relationship is meant to be. (Repeat).

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: In this gripping drama, a battered wife goes on the lam with her young daughter, but decides to fight back when her abusive husband tracks them down. (Repeat).

programme.title: The Net
programme.desc: After she stumbles across a top-secret program that can damage information networks, a computer ace must take it on the run from murderous cyberthugs who have literally deleted all evidence of her existence. (Repeat).

programme.title: While You Were Sleeping
programme.desc: A lonely turnstile clerk saves a man who has fallen onto the tracks, then poses as the comatose man's fiancée to gain access to his condition. (Repeat).

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
programme.desc: A cop offers to share his lottery ticket with a waitress he can't afford to tip. He hits the jackpot and wins millions, but his girlfriend tries to convince him to welch on his promise to the waitress. (Repeat).

programme.title: Save the Last Dance
programme.desc: A suburban ballet student moves to Chicago, where she finds a new way to express herself in the hip-hop culture of her inner-city high school and explore a new romance in this upbeat teen drama. (Repeat).

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: During the Civil War, the four daughters of a doctor who went to the front patiently wait for his return to their mother. Jo, Amy, Beth and Meg March try to compensate for their father's absence and lack of resources by continuing their creative activities and helping others. As we grow up, they all take a different path. Jo, who wants to become a writer, dreams of moving to New York. (Repeat).
